lead_paragraph: An operation to oust the Islamic State from a stronghold in Iraq raises concerns that it could feed the same sectarian tensions that have let militants flourish there.

byline.contributor: Falih Hassan and Omar Al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.

headline.print_headline: With Push Into Falluja by Iraqi Troops, Iran Assumes a Lead
headline.main: Iran-Led Push to Retake Falluja From ISIS Worries U.S.

snippet: An operation to oust the Islamic State from a stronghold in Iraq raises concerns that it could feed the same sectarian tensions that have let militants flourish there.
abstract: Iran has taken lead in backing up Iraqi military's push to take city of Falluja back from Islamic State militants, raising fears of sectarian bloodbath perpetuated by Iranian-supported Shiite militias; Iran's influence in Iraq limits American military action there, even as Sunni citizens trapped in city suffer.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
